Key Arguments: The legislation grants excessive power to the Australian Communications and Media Authority.
The definitions of 'misinformation', 'disinformation', and 'harm' are unacceptably broad.
The bill exempts governmental publications from scrutiny.
The vagueness of standards and severity of fines will lead to digital platforms shutting down controversial discussions.
Free speech, including unpopular opinions, is essential for intellectual growth and societal progress.
Government intervention should be minimized in favor of individual critical thinking and personal responsibility.
Main Themes: Importance of diverse viewpoints and debate
Notable Quotes: I find this proposed legislation deeply concerning, even going so far as to say that it is an assault on the bedrock principles of a democratic society.

The vagueness of the standards as well as the severity of the proposed fines threatened in this bill will cause digital platforms to actively shut down any discussions or opinions which could possibly be considered controversial.
A society that values free speech must be willing to protect even the most unpopular opinions.
